intro: Muscari muscari, commonly known as the grape hyacinth, is a bulbous plant native to Europe and parts of Western Asia. It produces dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, resembling clusters of grapes. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm and thrives in well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. It is a hardy perennial that is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to naturalize easily. The leaves are narrow and grass-like, emerging from the base of the plant in early spring.
